body.name: Sony 55 Inch 4K Ultra HD TV X77L Series: LED Smart Google TV KD55X77L- 2023 Model, Black
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Amazon Warehouse and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 18 hrs 49 mins
features: POWERFUL TV PROCESSING– The 4K Processor X1 delivers a lifelike picture that is full of rich colors and sharp details.
ENHANCED COLOR AND FINE DETAILS– See natural and precise picture quality with a wide array of colors and dynamic contrast.
PREMIUM SMART TV – Get access to all your favorite streaming apps in one place with Google TV, and simply use your voice to search and ask questions with Google Assistant. Supports Apple AirPlay.

EXCLUSIVE FEATURES FOR PLAYSTATION 5 – Take your gaming to the next level with exclusive features Auto HDR Tone Mapping and Auto Genre Picture Mode for optimized picture quality while gaming and streaming on your PS5 console.
INTELLIGENT MOTION HANDLING– See blur-free picture quality in fast-moving sports and action-packed movies powered by Motionflow XR.
UPSCALE ALL YOUR CONTENT– Bring back lost texture and detail and see all your content upscaled to near-4K resolution with 4K XR-Reality PRO.
WORKS WITH ALEXA – Through an Alexa enabled device, ask Alexa to change channels, adjust volume, and turn your TV on/off.
body.description: Experience all your favorite content in lifelike 4K HDR picture quality, powered by the 4K Processor X1™. All your HD content is upscaled to near-4K resolution resulting in sharp details and real-world colors. Google TV™ with Google assistant™ makes it easy to find your favorite movies and shows from all the top streaming apps. 55 pulgadas televisores

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Watch everything in 4K HDR X77K 4K HDR LED Google TV

Powerful TV processing See lifelike picture quality in incredible 4K resolution. The powerful 4K Processor X1 enhances the picture to deliver scenes full of rich colors and sharp details. Everything you watch is upscaled close to 4K quality with smooth and clear motion.

Beautiful 4K HDR picture See your favorite content burst to life on screen with High Dynamic Range (HDR) contrast. Every scene is enhanced to make colors and shadows even more natural and precise, so picture quality is closer than every to real life. The entertainment you love. With help from Google. With 700,000+ movies and TV episodes available across 10,000+ apps and 800+ free live TV channels, Google TV takes streaming to the next level – bringing together your favorite entertainment from across your apps and organizing it all, just for you. Looking for something special? Just ask Google.

Exclusive features for PlayStation 5 Auto HDR Tone Mapping automatically adjusts the HDR settings of the PS5 console to the TV for detailed, high-contrast scenes, and Auto Genre Picture Mode automatically adjusts the picture quality during gaming or streaming. Smooth and clear, even in fast scenes TV that keeps up with real life. Motionflow XR refresh rate technology keeps movement smooth and clear, allowing fast moving action sequences in sports and movies to be seen with lifelike clarity.

Upscale everything you watch See glorious 4K picture quality, rich with real-world detail and texture. Even content filmed in Full HD are upscaled close to 4K resolution by 4K X-Reality PRO using a unique 4K reference database. Family-friendly smart TV Create a Kids Profile that can help you guide children to age-appropriate content on streaming apps. Pick from a selection of playful avatars and themes, set parental controls to restrict what streaming services are shown, limit watching time, and even set bedtimes.

Can you control this TV with your voice? Yes, you can ask Google to find movies, stream apps, play music, and control the TV - all with your voice. Even get answers, control smart home devices, and more. Press the Google Assistant button on your remote to get started. Does this TV work with AirPlay 2? Yes, with Apple AirPlay 2 you can share pictures, video or audio to your television right from your iPhone, iPad or Mac. Watch movies and shows from your favorite apps and the Apple TV app, or even Safari. Share your photos with everyone in the room. Does this TV work with Alexa? Yes, through an Alexa enabled device (sold separately), ask Alexa to change channels, adjust volume, and turn your TV on/off.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy, Fast, Crisp, Clear
reviews.reviewText: Easy Installation. Fast doesn't lag, great panel. Crisp video, currently using my 4K Firestick. No problem with audio, only have to use 25 volume. Would absolutely recommend to anyone, wish I bought this for my room as well!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Got this for the living room and the picture quality is amazing. The sound is great too, we barely have to turn it up to hear it just fine, and I'm a bit hard of hearing. We play a lot of video games and the image and play is wonderful with the new consoles, maybe too good cause it can be hard to adjust to after the old TV we had. The setup is nice for the apps that come on the TV. It's easy to navigate, and we have no trouble with them unlike our Samsung that was missing apps or simply didn't want to play some of them. No lag at all. Just a great TV

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: At first, I went with a less-expensive brand that got great reviews on some review sites. Big mistake. The picture was dark and blurry. Exchanged it for this Sony. It's fabulous. Sharp, bright picture, great sound, easy setup, paired perfectly with Bluetooth headphones. I should have remembered that you can't beat Sony!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Vivid setting is great.. clear and crisp!
reviews.reviewText: I like the visuals, color is vibrant, sound is great.Can’t change to larger font- no option-a con-The viewing area is smaller than my 43 inch Samsung. It’s like the shrinking tv. The width is less and so is the height. Give us a larger viewing screen…not everyone wants a 55 or 65 inch set. The 43 inch set fits well in my armoire

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good price in comparison of others
reviews.reviewText: Purchased for family member for Christmas. Very happy with it, great picture and easy to operate. A lot of T.V. for the money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Cheap. Alternate Brands Must Be Better: Update 11/03/2023
reviews.reviewText: Revised 09/19/2023I bought:Gvirtue Universal Remote Control for Sony TV Remote, Replacement for All Sony LED OLED LCD Bravia 3D HDTV 4K 8K UHD HDR Android Google Smart TV, with Netflix, You Tube Button and Learning Functionhttps://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07Z9B7SXX?ref=ppx_pt2_dt_b_prod_imageWOW! No lag. Way more buttons to get where you want quickly. Did I say no lag?Throw away your Sony remote that came with this TV. It'll kill you!And you don't need to point it at the TV. It's IR but a cleverly placed LED lets you look straight at the remote and still get the button's press received by the TV. Did I mention no lag?The IR LED is so power-full that the signal bounces off ceilings and walls.This remote makes a cheap Sony TV very acceptable./End RevisionI've owned Sony TVs all my life (76yrs).They are more expensive but worth it.This is the first cheap Sony I've owned.And cheap it is (Stupid of me as this is like bottom of their line).Setup was excruciating. FÏinding the AC plugin was well not easy.Very poor instructions.It says much when you need to read the instructions (no manual)one page that folds out and out and... And I needed a magnifyingglass to read it. I think the AC port was shown but the quality ofthe diagram/print was poor.Google TV. A joke. No instructions.I wanted to add Sling to my Home page.No way I could figure it out.Google TV was supposed to limit the amount of steps/scrolling tosee/find what you want.Not so. A mess. Not intuitive. Irritating lag.Picture quality good. Adjusting screen parameters just fairly easy.I believe I've found 3 to 4 places where settings are made. Really?Changing inputs is not clear. As I write this I do not know how to do this.I did it once but don't remember how I got there.I'll stumbled accross it again I suppose. Instructions please!All in all very disappointed in Sony even for a cheap set.If I ever buy another cheap TV it won't be a Sony.Sony: How hard would it be to have navigation on a cheap set the same as yourmore expensive ones?Cheap Sony TVs have bad navigation.Spend another $1K with Sony to get a slick interface.Thanks... KenUpdate 11/03/2023: 2 stars -- 1 starBluetooth paired devices volume control via remote gets stuck on one volume.Only way to recover is to reset the TV.All settings lost.Google TV interface freezes ~twice a day.Sling app crashes regularly.Thanks... Ken

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I was replacing an older Sony TV that stopped working and this one worked perfect. It was a little hard to get set up, but once it was programmed, it works fine. The price was right and it came fast.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Decent Picture. Slow Google Interface. No Dolby Vision Support.
reviews.reviewText: Let me preface my comments by saying that I am a devoted Sony customer and have several Sony home theater and audio components in my home.I purchased this 43 inch Sony Bravia TV so my son could watch it occasionally instead of commandeering my living room 65 inch Sony when I'm trying to watch something like a live sporting event. For the purposes of providing a decent picture, the Sony 43 inch is adequate but doesn't come close to the stunning picture quality of the older Sony X950H in the living room, which unlike the 43 inch Bravia supports Dolby Vision.The processor on the 43 inch Bravia also seems to lag significantly when using the Google interface sometimes taking up to a minute or more to actually appear on screen. Luckily, I have an Apple TV 4k connected to the TV, so I don't have to deal with the frustrating lag of Google interface on the Bravia. It should be noted that the older 65 inch Bravia doesn't have this lag problem and both TVs are getting more than adequate network throughput speed from my EERO mesh routers.Finally, unlike other manufacturers, Sony never divulges the firmware update version that has (if it ever is) downloaded to the TV and never indicates whether any firmware (software) has been installed on a specific date. As a result the user simply has no idea if Sony is ever offering a firmware update to the TV or not...and sadly must assume that Sony never really updates the TV's firmware after the set has been purchased. For a company that prides itself on its engineering prowess and making impressive televisions, especially for picture quality, this is a glaring omission and a signal to its customers that they just don't need to know these petty details. One must also assume that the Sony engineers will never provide a firmware update to the 43 inch X77L to support Dolby Vision or any other enhancements or improvements (lag fixing the lag issue on the Google interface...which should concern the folks at Google).So, if you want a pleasant viewing experience, connect an Apple TV 4k to the Sony X77L and also connect some external speakers (I've connected a pair of NOTABRICK Bluetooth speakers that are recognized by the Apple TV 4k set top box) and provide much better sound than what the 43 Bravia can do on its own. Just don't expect a phenomenal picture or Dolby Vision support or any firmware updates from the Sony team. Do better, Sony.

reviews.reviewTitle: Calidad suprema como todo lo de Sony
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. La pantalla es hermosa, tiene una calidad de imagen súper excelente, tiene un muy buen tamaño, funciona bastante fluido con el Google TV, tengo PS5 y XSX y se ven todos los juegos con gran calidad y fluidez. Fue una ganga el precio que agarré en oferta.

I bought the 43” for my bedroom and it’s the perfect size. I also bought a sound bar and subwoofer because the speakers in the TV are “ lacking “ in the sound quality. The Bravia has to many options to list, but I had everything hooked up and ready to go in about 15 minutes. The most time consuming part of setting up a new TV, is the settings themselves, and Sony has put a lot of different settings in this TV. I was actually surprised by this because a lot of the options and settings are usually only found on higher end TV’s. I’ve had no problems so far, but I have heard from other buyers that the Bluetooth can get flakey or in simple terms, it loses the connection but reconnects after a few seconds. I would find that very annoying. If it happens with mine, it will be returned or hopefully Sony has a patch that can be downloaded to the TV. All in all, this is a great TV from a trusted brand. I hope it lasts for a very long time.

I bought the 65 inch version of the Sony X77L to replace my still working 12 year old Sony 46inch LCD on a black Friday deal. Reading other reviews, I was concerned the TV would arrive damaged due to delivery, but I was lucky, the TV arrived in 2 days, well packaged, and in absolutely perfect condition, the delivery driver even helped me move it into the house! Although this is Sony's "entry level" 4K TV, it is a huge upgrade over our old TV. I have no complaints about the picture quality, if you want to pay much more, Sony does have higher end TVs that probably produce blacker blacks, and maybe marginally smoother picture, but for the price, you cannot beat this tv! I am not using the smart features as I have my Apple TV 4K box connected via HDMI arc, and it works great. No need to use the Native Sony Google TV system if you love your Apple TV box!
Muy buena TV, la uso para jugar con mi PS5 y se ve genial, recomendada, además las plataformas de streaming al 100.

siento un poco mejor el modelo KD-65X77K que este KD-65X77L que es un poco lenta, ya la reinicié de fábrica y quedó mejor, aún así el control se siente un poco de juguete al lado del control de la 65X77K.la imagen es muy buena, sobre todo para el precio, en 11,000 pesos mexicanos.el tamaño es ideal para un departamento.no me he podido conectar por wifi, yo uso lan, pero me preocupa ese mal funcionamiento, por si lo llegara a necesitar en el futuro, seguiré probando.
